modName: Oblivion Hair Pack Fixed now with NPCEditor Support
summary:
Updated to v2.3.1
It\'s a fixed version of the Oblivion Hair Mod to a more natural look and now also with NPCEditor Support.
Download NOW! And create your own NPC and upload the images here OR Check out my companion mods!
descriptionHtml:
[color=red] [size=6] [center] UPDATE v2.3.1 is available now!
Now with NPC Editor support!
Check it out!
NOTE: I stopped modding Skyrim for now. [/center] [/size] [/color]

[center][color=yellow][b][size=2]Thanks for the[/color][/b][/size] [color=red][size=4]500 Endorsements[/color][/size] [color=yellow][b][size=2]and interest in my mod![/color][/b][/size][/center]


[center] [youtube]NvOnsaqbwB4[/youtube] [/center]

This mod will fix the shininess of the original Oblivion Hair Mod.
The original mod is NOT required!
It adds 56 new female and 12 male hairstyles

[b][color=yellow][u]Followers which use these hairstyles:[/b][/u][/color]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/23639]Jasmin Lunari Follower[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/23469]Victoria The Slayer[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/23900]Celes Lunari Follower[/url]

[b][color=yellow][u]Changelog:[/b][/u][/color]
2.3.1 Added a little shine version of VB Hairpack
2.3 Added the VB Hairpack which includes 4 more hairstyles
2.2 Added NPC Editor support for part 1 too and merged with part 2 to a AIO Pack
     (You may need to reselect your hairstyle in the showracemenu)
2.1 Added NPC Editor support for part 2
2.0 Added Part1 of the original Hair Pack
1.5 More natural look and fixed some bugs
1.0 Initial release

When you guys know another mod which has to much shine like this one, let me know and I\'ll try to fix it for you!
Also tell me if you find any issues with the mod! Haven\'t got enough time to test it completly, yet.

[b][color=yellow] [u] INSTALLATION (NMM): [/color][/u] [/b]     <------RECOMMENDED OPTION
1. Download the mod with the NexusModManager
2. Activate it with it and overwrite if asked ( but normally you dont have to)
3. Check if the ESM or ESP file is checked in your Plugins-List (I\'m sure the most of you know)
4. Enjoy the game without annoying shiny hair!

[b][color=yellow] [u] INSTALLATION (MANUALLY): [/color][/u] [/b] 
1. Download the mod manually to your PC
2. Extract the archive with any Compression tool (eg. Winrar, 7Zip..)
3. Drop the files in the DATA folder of your Skyrim directory and overwrite if asked
4. Activate the ESM or ESP file in your Skyrim Launcher
5. Enjoy the game without annoying shiny hair!

[b][color=yellow] [u] Troubleshooting: [/color][/u] [/b]
[list]
[*] To avoid CTD, I recommend to only install the mods you really need, ( don\'t use all hair mods available on the nexus for example)
[*] For solving CTD disable all mods except the one you want to run and try.
[*] If you use the showracemenu console command, I recommend that you use it in a small cell like a house or you use [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/18148] Light Room [/url] mod.
[*] Also close all background programms, like your browser.
[*] And all the other things that I can\'t remember right now but increase the general performance of the game.
[*] Upgrade your system to enjoy more mods at the same time ;)
[/list]


[b] Please [color=red] COMMENT [/color] and [color=red] ENDORSE![/color] [/b]

[color=yellow][b][u]My Mods:[/u][/b] [size=0.5](Click the images)[/size][/color]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/23639]Jasmin Lunari Race 1H Trainer Follower[/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/23900]Celes Lunari Follower[/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/23951]Nadine Temptress Marksman Trainer and Follower[/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/23469] [img]http://t0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTBuIeKoKH9jIptIO8_HCVGKCB1sR_rxIKp59maVOHrVR8ZMWTQww&t=1[/img][/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/22816] [img] http://vagrantbard.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/fallout_3_icon.png[/img][/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/22351] [img] http://i.ytimg.com/vi/B4ImJOK1fBE/0.jpg[/img][/url]

I\'m NOT the creator of the original mod, I just fixed the shininess problem!
All rights go to Radioragae, the creator of the original mod.
The original mod is found at [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/18110]here.[/url]
Also thanks to apachii for the Apachiis Hair Mod, which helped me to fix the problem, but no data of Apachiis Hair Mod is used in mine.
author: DragonAge7
